name: Memorial to Diverse Ethnic and Commonwealth People In War
introduction: This monument is to recognise and pay tribute to the diverse ethnic and commonwealth soldiers during WWI and WWII. It is unveiled on November 2019, as a finale of Black History Month Wales.

name: Drinking Fountain
introduction: Design by sculptors Wills Brothers in 1860, the drinking fountain was originally a part of the Town Hall in St Mary Street and was relocated when the building was demolished in 1914.

name: Magistrate Court
introduction: Created by Louise Shenstone and Adrian Butler in 1993, this 9 metre high mosaic adorns Cardiff’s Magistrates Court. The figure of justice is surrounded by symbols of order and balance.

name: Girl
introduction: This sculpture is created by Welsh sculptor Robert Thomas who born in Cwmparc. It is situated in Gorsedd Gardens, that contains a number of other statues.

name: Welsh National Falklands War Memorial
introduction: The Falklands War Memorial was created in 2007 to commemorate those who died in the Falklands conflict of 1982. The memorial was created by the Wales branch of the South Atlantic Medal Association and the stone on the top is taken directly from Mount Harriet in 1982.

name: Spanish Civil War Memorial
introduction: This stone memorial was created in 1992 to commemorate the 169 Welsh Volunteers who helped aid the Spanish civil war in the 1930; 36 of which died in the conflict.

name: Gift of Life Stone
introduction: This memorial stone was gifted by Kidney Wales (2007) to commemorate those who have donated organs to the charity over the years since 1967, and even those before then Including the youngest organ donor in the UK Teddy Houlston from Cardiff who donated organs after just 100 minutes of being alive.

name: From Pit to Port
introduction: This sculpture made by Jon Buck and John Clinch, commemorates the contribution of all of the people who formed the link in the chain between exports at Cardiff Docks and the coal mining industry in the Welsh Valleys. This sculpture was finished in 2005 and features a life size coal miner leaning against a dram containing a pit winding wheel, smoking factory chimney and ship, symbolical of the cycle of the coal industry which the docklands are well known for.

name: Antarctic 100
introduction: This statue was awarded by the British Antarctic Heratige Trust in commemoration of the 100th anniversary of the “Age of Antarctic Descovery” and was formally unveiled in June 2003 by her Royal Highness, the Princess Royal. The statue depicts Captain Scott and his comrades encased in the snow. The base of the statue is a compass rose which now is illuminated at night by embedded lights.

name: Harmony Peace
introduction: Sculpted by Kaivalya Torpy, this statue was donated to Cardiff by the World Harmony Run and was unveiled on March 11th 2012 by the Lord Mayor of Cardiff. The statue marks the 25th anniversary of the world harmony run. This statue is a symbol that promotes peace and understanding.

folder: A Wood Sculpture In Bute Park
name: A Wood Sculpture In Bute Park
National Cycle Network Milestones
introduction: To celebrate the National Cycle Network at the start of the 21th century, Sustrans commissioned four artists from the four countries of the United Kingdom to design cast iron ‘Millennium Mileposts’. The first post to be commissioned was designed by Brighton based Jon Mills, entitled “The Fossil Tree”. The post takes the form of an abstract tree with relief imagery of fossils depicting the passage of time from early primitive creatures to the ultimate demise of fossil fuel driven technology.
